content:
XmlSchemaType Class

Definition

The base class for all simple types and complex types.

In this Article

public class XmlSchemaType : System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaAnnotated
Inheritance
Object
XmlSchemaObject
XmlSchemaAnnotated
XmlSchemaType

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)
ToString()
Annotation
Id
UnhandledAttributes
LineNumber
LinePosition
Namespaces
Parent
SourceUri

Examples

See the XmlSchemaSimpleType class and the XmlSchemaComplexType class for an example using this class.

Constructors

XmlSchemaType()

Initializes a new instance of the XmlSchemaType class.

public XmlSchemaType ();

Properties

BaseSchemaType

Gets the post-compilation object type or the built-in XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) data type, simpleType element, or complexType element. This is a post-schema-compilation infoset property.

public object BaseSchemaType { get; }
Value
Object

The built-in XSD data type, simpleType element, or complexType element.

Remarks

The complexType is derived from the type specified by the base value. The base value must be a QName.

Important

The BaseSchemaType property is obsolete and has been replaced by the BaseXmlSchemaType property.

BaseXmlSchemaType

Gets the post-compilation value for the base type of this schema type.

public System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaType BaseXmlSchemaType { get; }
Value
XmlSchemaType

An XmlSchemaType object representing the base type of this schema type.

Remarks

The BaseXmlSchemaType property always has a value, because all schema types have a base type. This value is set upon schema compilation, making it a part of the post-schema-compilation infoset.

Datatype

Gets the post-compilation value for the data type of the complex type.

public System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDatatype Datatype { get; }
Value
XmlSchemaDatatype

The XmlSchemaDatatype post-schema-compilation value.

DerivedBy

Gets the post-compilation information on how this element was derived from its base type.

public System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod DerivedBy { get; }
Value
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod

One of the valid XmlSchemaDerivationMethod values.

Remarks

The following table shows the values that this property can contain.

XmlSchemaDerivationMethod value Description
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod No derivation method specified.
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod Derived by Substitution.
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod Derived by Extension.
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod Derived by Restriction.
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod Derived by List.
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod Derived by Union.

Final

Gets or sets the final attribute of the type derivation that indicates if further derivations are allowed.

public System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod Final { get; set; }
Value
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod

One of the valid XmlSchemaDerivationMethod values. The default is XmlSchemaDerivationMethod.

Remarks

The following table shows the values that this property can contain for simple type.

XmlSchemaDerivationMethod value Description
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod Overrides the schema blockDefault setting allowing any derivations by restriction, extension, or substitution to take place.
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod No derivation method is specified. This is the default. Derivation rules are taken from the schema blockDefault setting.
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod Cannot be replaced by a type derived by Substitution.
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod Cannot be replaced by a type derived by Extension.
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod Cannot be replaced by a type derived by Restriction.
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod #all. Cannot be replaced by a type derived by any derivation method.

The following table shows the values that this property can contain for complex type.

XmlSchemaDerivationMethod value Description
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod Overrides the schema blockDefault setting allowing any derivations by restriction, extension, or substitution to take place.
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod No derivation method is specified. This is the default. Derivation rules are taken from the schema blockDefault setting.
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod Cannot be replaced by a type derived by Substitution.
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod Cannot be replaced by a type derived by Extension.
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod Cannot be replaced by a type derived by Restriction.
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod #all. Cannot be replaced by a type derived by any derivation method.

FinalResolved

Gets the post-compilation value of the stem.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaType.Final* property.

public System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod FinalResolved { get; }
Value
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod

The post-compilation value of the stem.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaType.Final* property. The default is the finalDefault attribute value of the schema element.

Remarks

This value indicates how the type is restricted when the type is extended through restriction. If the type is marked as final, this type cannot be extended.

IsMixed

Gets or sets a value indicating if this type has a mixed content model. This property is only valid in a complex type.

public virtual bool IsMixed { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the type has a mixed content model; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

This virtual method is overridden in derived classes.

Name

Gets or sets the name of the type.

public string Name { get; set; }
Value
String

The name of the type.

Remarks

The name must be an no-colon name (NCName) as defined in the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) XML Namespaces specification. If specified, the name must be unique among all simpleType and complexType elements.

QualifiedName

Gets the qualified name for the type built from the Name attribute of this type. This is a post-schema-compilation property.

public System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName QualifiedName { get; }
Value
XmlQualifiedName

The XmlQualifiedName for the type built from the Name attribute of this type.

TypeCode

Gets the XmlTypeCode of the type.

public System.Xml.Schema.XmlTypeCode TypeCode { get; }
Value
XmlTypeCode

One of the XmlTypeCode values.

Methods

GetBuiltInComplexType(XmlTypeCode)

Returns an XmlSchemaComplexType that represents the built-in complex type of the complex type specified.

public static System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaComplexType GetBuiltInComplexType (System.Xml.Schema.XmlTypeCode typeCode);
Parameters
typeCode
XmlTypeCode

One of the XmlTypeCode values representing the complex type.

Returns
XmlSchemaComplexType

The XmlSchemaComplexType that represents the built-in complex type.

GetBuiltInComplexType(XmlQualifiedName)

Returns an XmlSchemaComplexType that represents the built-in complex type of the complex type specified by qualified name.

public static System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaComplexType GetBuiltInComplexType (System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName qualifiedName);
Parameters
qualifiedName
XmlQualifiedName

The XmlQualifiedName of the complex type.

Returns
XmlSchemaComplexType

The XmlSchemaComplexType that represents the built-in complex type.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The XmlQualifiedName parameter is null.

GetBuiltInSimpleType(XmlTypeCode)

Returns an XmlSchemaSimpleType that represents the built-in simple type of the specified simple type.

public static System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSimpleType GetBuiltInSimpleType (System.Xml.Schema.XmlTypeCode typeCode);
Parameters
typeCode
XmlTypeCode

One of the XmlTypeCode values representing the simple type.

Returns
XmlSchemaSimpleType

The XmlSchemaSimpleType that represents the built-in simple type.

Remarks

You cannot directly serialize the built-in type. If you need to serialize the type, create a new simple type which derives from the built-in type and serialize the simple type.

GetBuiltInSimpleType(XmlQualifiedName)

Returns an XmlSchemaSimpleType that represents the built-in simple type of the simple type that is specified by the qualified name.

public static System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSimpleType GetBuiltInSimpleType (System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName qualifiedName);
Parameters
qualifiedName
XmlQualifiedName

The XmlQualifiedName of the simple type.

Returns
XmlSchemaSimpleType

The XmlSchemaSimpleType that represents the built-in simple type.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The XmlQualifiedName parameter is null.

Remarks

You cannot directly serialize the built-in type. If you need to serialize the type, create a new simple type which derives from the built-in type and serialize the simple type.

IsDerivedFrom(XmlSchemaType, XmlSchemaType, XmlSchemaDerivationMethod)

Returns a value indicating if the derived schema type specified is derived from the base schema type specified

public static bool IsDerivedFrom (System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaType derivedType, System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaType baseType, System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDerivationMethod except);
Parameters
derivedType
XmlSchemaType

The derived XmlSchemaType to test.

baseType
XmlSchemaType

The base XmlSchemaType to test the derived XmlSchemaType against.

except
XmlSchemaDerivationMethod

One of the XmlSchemaDerivationMethod values representing a type derivation method to exclude from testing.

Returns
Boolean

true if the derived type is derived from the base type; otherwise, false.
